page.title: 14RELIGION IN MORETON
page.content: There are four{places of worship}in Moreton. St. David's, the Anglican Church, St. George's, the Roman Catholic Church, the Congregational Church and the Fosseway Evangelical Gospel Hall(generally known as Open Brethren). The Congregational and Anglican{churches}are both made of Cotswold stone. The Congregational Church was built in 1895 and St. David's in 1861. The Gospel Hall is a wooden building built in 1948. St. George's is built of reconstituted stone and was erected in 1956 (mainly with U.S.A.F. money). The Anglican Clergyman also looks after the Parish churches of Todenham, Lower Lemington and Batsford. The Catholic Priest comes to Moreton from Chipping Campden. The Gospel Hall has no{minister,}but there are 6 elders (all men, women can't take services).
